meanings.definition: To hit or strike someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He bonked the ball with his bat.
meanings.sent2: The hammer bonked the nail into the wall.
meanings.sent3: The clown accidentally bonked himself on the head with a rubber chicken.
meanings.sent4: The storm bonked the trees with strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The toddler bonked his toy against the table repeatedly.

meanings.sent1: The birds bonked in the tree branches.
meanings.sent2: The rabbits bonked in the field.
meanings.sent3: The movie characters bonked in a comical scene.
meanings.sent4: The waves bonked against the shore in a rhythmic manner.
meanings.sent5: The monkeys bonked playfully in the zoo enclosure.

meanings.sent1: After playing all day, the kids were bonked and ready for bed.
meanings.sent2: The hiker bonked after climbing the steep mountain.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner bonked at the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The computer bonked after running multiple programs simultaneously.
meanings.sent5: The dog bonked after chasing the ball non-stop.
